briefdescription.para: Opens the provided filename to the poDataset object.

parameterdescription.para: file to open in read-only mode.

briefdescription.para: Overloaded open for using the preset file name.
Checks if the connection to the map file has already been opened.

detaileddescription.para:
All this does is check if poDataset is a null pointer.
true if poDataset is a null pointer.

briefdescription.para: Destroys the connection to the dataset.
Sets the raster band to the first raster.
Obtains the x and y dimensions from the tif file for reading in blocks.
Sets the no data, data type and data type name values from the tif file.
Gets the upper left x (longitude) coordinate.

simplesect.para: upper left x of the map

briefdescription.para: Gets the upper left y (latitude) coordinate.

simplesect.para: upper left y of the map

briefdescription.para: Imports the matrix from a csv file.

parameterdescription.para: if type detection for the filename fails.
the file to import.

briefdescription.para: Imports the matrix from a tif file using the gdal library functions.

simplesect.para: Opens a connection to the file object, which should be closed.

parameterdescription.para: the path to the file to import.

briefdescription.para: Opens the offset map and fetches the metadata.

parameterdescription.para: the offset map to open (should be the larger map).

simplesect.para: true if the offset map is opened within this function

briefdescription.para: Calculates the offset between the two maps.

detaileddescription.para: The offset_map should be larger and contain this map, otherwise returned values will be negative

simplesect.para: Opens a connection to the tif file (if it has not already been opened), which is then closed. If the connection is already open, then it will not be closed and it is assumed logic elsewhere achieves this.
Offsets are returned as rounded integers at the resolution of the smaller map.

parameterdescription.para: the offset map to read from
the x offset variable to fill
the y offset variable to fill

briefdescription.para: Calculates the relative scale of this map compared to the offset map.

detaileddescription.para: The offset map should be larger and contain this map.

simplesect.para: Only the x resolution is checked, it is assumed the x and y resolutions of both maps is the same (i.e. each cell on the map is a square.

parameterdescription.para: the offset map object to read from

simplesect.para: the relative scale of the offset map

briefdescription.para: Default importer when we rely on the default gdal method of converting between values. Note that importing doubles to ints results in the values being rounded down.

simplesect.para: true if a tif file exists and can be imported, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Default import routine for any type. Provided as a separate function so implementation can be called from any template class type.
Imports from the supplied filename into the GeoTiff object, converting doubles to booleans. The threshold for conversion is x>0.5 -> true, false otherwise.
Imports from the supplied filename into the GeoTiff object, converting doubles to booleans. The threshold for conversion is x>0.5 -> true, false otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: the buffer type for the data
the template type for data reading.

briefdescription.para: Print the percentage complete during import.

parameterdescription.para: the reference for the counter
the number of previously printed lines

briefdescription.para: Checks the error code of the CPLErr object and formats the error.
Equality operator.

parameterdescription.para: the Map object to copy from

simplesect.para: the self Map object

briefdescription.para: Overloaded functions for importing from tifs and matching between gdal and C types.
Sets the matrix size. Similar concept to that for Rows.

parameterdescription.para: the number of rows.
the number of columns.

briefdescription.para: Getter for the number of columns.

simplesect.para: the number of columns.

briefdescription.para: Getter for the number of rows.

simplesect.para: the number of rows.

briefdescription.para: Overoads the [] operator for Matrix. Allows referencing of a value i,j using Matrix[i][j]. Includes error checking for if the indices are out of range of the matrix. Note that this functionality has been altered since the original file generation.

parameterdescription.para: the row number to get the value from.

simplesect.para: the matrix row object.

briefdescription.para: Overloading the + operator.

parameterdescription.para: the matrix to add to this matrix.

simplesect.para: the matrix object which is the sum of the two matrices.

briefdescription.para: Overloading the - operator.

parameterdescription.para: the matrix to subtract from this matrix.

simplesect.para: the matrix object which is the subtraction of the two matrices.

briefdescription.para: Overloading the += operator so that the new object is written to the current object.

parameterdescription.para: the Matrix object to add to this matrix.

briefdescription.para: Overloading the -= operator so that the new object is written to the current object.

parameterdescription.para: the Matrix object to subtract from this matrix.

briefdescription.para: Overloading the * operator for scaling.

parameterdescription.para: the constant to scale the matrix by.

simplesect.para: the scaled matrix.

briefdescription.para: Overloading the * operator for matrix multiplication. Multiplies each value in the matrix with its corresponding value in the other matrix.

parameterdescription.para: the matrix to multiply with

simplesect.para: the product of each ith,jth value of the matrix.

memberdef.argsstring: (const unsigned long &x, const unsigned long &y, const char *value)
